inlineContent.text: provides many conversion and methods to manipulate dates and times.
Time precision is provided down to microseconds and the time can range
follows POSIX time in the sense that it is oblivious to leap
seconds.
is an immutable object; once it has been created it cannot
be modified further. All modifiers will create a new
Nearly all such functions can fail due to the date or time going out
of range, in which case
will be returned.
is reference counted: the reference count is increased by calling
[method
] and decreased by calling [method
When the reference count drops to 0, the resources allocated by the
structure are released.
Many parts of the API may produce non-obvious results. As an
example, adding two months to January 31st will yield March 31st
whereas adding one month and then one month again will yield either
March 28th or March 29th.  Also note that adding 24 hours is not
always the same as adding one day (since days containing daylight
savings time transitions are either 23 or 25 hours in length).
The
type acts as a lightweight Swift reference to an underlying
instance.
It exposes methods that can operate on this data type through
conformance.
Use
only as an
reference to an existing
instance.
Use
(instead of
) if you want to use Automatic Reference Counting for memory management of the underlying
instance.
